section.instruction: Peel Potatoes, cut into chunks and place in a pot.
Add Salt, then add Water until Potatoes are covered.
Bring Potatoes to a boil, then reduce heat to medium.

While Potatoes are heating up:
Place Peas in a 9&inch; &by; 9&inch; glass pan, and heat in microwave
Brown Hamburger in yet another pan
Slice Cheese into thin slices
When Hamburger is done browning, add Soup, stir well, then remove from heat.
When Potatoes are soft, drain water, add Butter and Milk, and mash well.
Place Hamburger on top of Peas and spread evenly.
Place mashed Potatoes on top of Hamburger and spread evenly.
Place Cheese evenly across top of mashed Potatoes.
Turn oven to broil, then put in Shepherd's Pie just until Cheese melts. (Should be less than a couple of minutes.)

Notes.note: Potatoes are usually mashed with a potato masher, but I find it easier to use a mixer. If you don't have either, you can use a fork, but that is painful.
The goal is to finish mashing Potatoes, browning Hamburger and heating Peas at the same time. That way, the Shepherd's Pie is already hot when it is assembled.

Modifications.modification: Instead of Golden Mushroom Soup, you can use simple Brown Gravy with Salt and Pepper. Or better yet, Brown Gravy with Montreal Steak Seasoning.
Instead of Peas, you can use just about any vegetable: Corn, Green Beans, even Mixed Vegetables.

If you do not have a microwave available, or if you don't have a microwave safe 9&inch; &by; 9&inch; pan, heat the Peas in a separate pan with a little water. Then drain and place in 9&inch; &by; 9&inch; pan.
